text: Could be that the reason it doesn't work if you name your file email.py is because when you first try importing the module, it confuses python so it thinks your file is the module you're trying to import!  Can also happen if an email.py file is in the same directory as your script.

author: @privacyIDEA
text: right in the smtplib.py it imports email.base64mime. So if you call your file email.py, smtplib will not load, as it you have a circular import and smtplib again tries to import "base64mime" from your file. Anyway! Thanks for this nice tutorial!

author: @emuzehh
text: The email.py thing is probably because there's a file in the smtplib module called email.py which it uses in the sending of the email, so when you call your file email.py it uses that instead of the one in the module.
